definition: to call in (to a broadcast program) (loanword) (Tw)

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: I like to watch call-in programs on TV.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡看電視上的扣應節目。
